required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Rural MOUD Telemedicine in Primary Care Phase 1
clinical_study.official_title: Rural Expansion of Medication Treatment for Opioid Use Disorder (Rural MOUD): Phase 1 Feasibility Study (CTN-0102)

brief_summary.textblock: The feasibility study (Phase 1) will examine the implementation of telemedicine (TM) in six rural clinics in two states/regions with varying levels of OBOT capacity.

detailed_description.textblock:
The dramatic increases in opioid overdose deaths across the nation, particularly in rural areas, call for a rapid expansion of access to medication treatment for opioid use disorder (MOUD).There is a need to study effective ways to expand treatment access and improve retention on MOUD in rural areas highly impacted by OUD. Telemedicine (TM) for MOUD offers an alternative or supplementary approach to delivering MOUD that may be suitable for rural clinics and patients with OUD.
The objectives of the feasibility study are to study ways of incorporating TM into primary care clinics and to evaluate the associated outcomes, based on EHRs from the clinics and the TM vendor (i.e., patient days on MOUD) and participant surveys (e.g., opioid use). Additional outcomes of the feasibility study are feasibility and acceptability assessed from the perspectives of providers and participants via focus groups. A patient registry will be established in each clinic to track patients with OUD diagnoses, and those in the registry will be provided the opportunity to consent for sharing identified EHRs and participating in the follow-up surveys.

primary_outcome.measure: Patient days on MOUD from Electronic Health Records (EHR)
primary_outcome.description: Number of days patients receive MOUD based on EHR data

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of OUD patients initiating/receiving MOUD
secondary_outcome.description: Number of OUD patients initiating/receiving MOUD

other_outcome.description: Number of patients retained in treatment at 3 months post baseline

arm_group.arm_group_label: Integration of telemedicine in primary care settings for MOUD
arm_group.description: Primary care providers may refer OUD patients to receive telemedicine for MOUD

intervention.intervention_name: Integration of telemedicine for MOUD in primary care
intervention.description: Patients with opioid use disorder in rural primary care settings may be referred to receive telemedicine for medication treatment for opioid use disorder
intervention.arm_group_label: Integration of telemedicine in primary care settings for MOUD

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged 18-80 years old, inclusive, at the time of the qualifying visit
- with OUD diagnosis
- At least 1 visit to the participating clinics from 9 months before and 6 months after the date of intervention implementation

clinical_study.keyword: Medication treatment for opioid use disorder

patient_data.ipd_description: The main dataset will be de-identified participant survey data and shared on the NIDA Data Share website.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: The data on NIDA Data Share website are accessible to anyone.
